answerText: dyneins[10] Dyneins are found in these organelles which are used by many cells for propulsion. They consist of nine fused microtubule doublets surrounding two unpaired microtubules, and are necessarily motile, unlike their smaller counterparts.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale A | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These proteins walk along microtubules in the minus-end direction. For 10 points each: [10] Name this class of proteins which facilitates axoplasmic transport and helps position the mitotic spindles during cell division.
